properties.description: Boston Tea Party occurred, with American colonists led by Samuel Adams and the Sons of Liberty boarding British ships and dumping 342 chests of tea into Boston Harbor.
The Tea Act of 1773 was passed.
The Tea Act granted the British East India Company a monopoly on tea sales in the American colonies.

The mechanism through which the Tea Act led to rebellion: (1) Tea Act imposed taxation without colonial representation; (2) This created economic pressure and ideological mobilization; (3) Sons of Liberty channeled discontent into organized resistance; (4) Resistance culminated in direct action against British property.

Groups like the Sons of Liberty channeled this discontent into organized resistance.
The resistance culminated in direct action against British property.
